private_information: I specialize in extracting operator schemas and parameter typing from natural language requirements.
I normalize predicate and action names and present them in a structured, machine-readable form.
I do not emit PDDL; I prepare neutral JSON-like operator specs for downstream compilation.
domain_curator.goal: Derive a consistent, minimal operator specification with parameters, preconditions, add-effects, and delete-effects that matches the public action descriptions.

private_information: I ground scenarios into explicit object sets, initial states, and goal sets.
I unify object references and prepare per-scenario models without changing the semantics of the given facts.
I do not emit PDDL; I emit grounded state descriptions and object universes.
state_modeler.goal: Produce grounded models for each scenario, including object lists, initial facts, goals, and any helpful aliasing or normalization notes.

private_information: I audit temporal/causal consistency across operator specs and grounded scenarios.
I detect unreachable steps, missing preconditions, contradictory effects, and bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, hidden resources).
I recommend repairs that keep semantics faithful while removing shortcuts or inconsistencies.
I do not emit PDDL; I emit an audit report with actionable guidance.
auditor.goal: Verify that the operators and grounded scenarios are causally coherent, flag inconsistencies, and recommend precise fixes so that a planner can solve the problems.

private_information: I coordinate all agents and compile their outputs into a final PDDL domain and problem files suitable for FastDownward.
I ensure correct STRIPS semantics with clear typing and predicate definitions.
I keep action names exactly as specified in the public information.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a correct PDDL domain and problem files that are solvable by FastDownward and faithful to the curated operators, grounded scenarios, and audit guidance.

public_information: Action paltry(x, y, z) preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, next y z; add: next x z; del: vase x y.
Action sip(x, y, z) preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, next y z; add: vase x y; del: next x z.
Action clip(x, y, z) preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, next x z; add: vase x y; del: next x z.
Action wretched(w, x, y, z) preconditions: sneeze w, texture x, texture y, stupendous z, next w x, collect x z, collect y z; add: next w y; del: next w x.
Action memory(x, y, z) preconditions: cats x, spring y, spring z, next x y; add: next x z; del: next x y.
Action tightfisted(x, y, z) preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, vase x y; add: next x z; del: vase x y.

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_3; hand object_8; hand object_9; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_6; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_7; next object_8 object_7; next object_9 object_7; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_7; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7.
Scenario 1 goal: next object_8 object_7; next object_9 object_6.
Scenario 1 proposed plan: memory object_1 object_6 object_7; sip object_9 object_1 object_7; memory object_1 object_7 object_6; paltry object_9 object_1 object_6.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_9; next object_0 object_7; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_7; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.

extract_domain.system_prompt: You are a domain curator who converts natural language action descriptions into a structured non-PDDL operator specification. Keep original action names and argument order, assign a single type obj to all parameters, and emit a compact JSON-like structure with keys: actions, parameters, preconditions, add_effects, del_effects. Do not emit PDDL.
extract_domain.prompt: Your name is domain_curator. Use the public information to extract the six operators paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters and their preconditions, add-effects, and delete-effects. Keep predicate names and arities as stated, assume all parameters are of type obj, and output a concise operators_json enclosed in <operators_json> tags based solely on: {environment->public_information}.

scenario_synthesis.system_prompt: You ground objects and scenarios without changing semantics. Normalize the object universe, list per-scenario initial facts and goals, and include any helpful aliasing notes. Do not emit PDDL.
scenario_synthesis.prompt: Your name is state_modeler. From {environment->public_information} and the curated operators in {domain_spec}, produce grounded models for scenario_1 and scenario_2 with keys: objects, init, goal, and notes. Preserve all given facts; do not invent new objects or predicates. If a provided plan exists (scenario 1), include a brief feasibility note that checks preconditions step by step without altering the facts.

causal_audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Detect missing preconditions, contradictory effects, illegal bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, hidden resources), and unreachable goals. Recommend minimal repairs while preserving intent. Do not emit PDDL.
causal_audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using {domain_spec} and {grounded_models}, verify that operator schemas are consistent and that each scenario is solvable or explain why not. For scenario 1, evaluate the proposed plan’s steps against preconditions and effects. For scenario 2, suggest factual adjustments or operator usage hints only if necessary to make the goal reachable without introducing new predicates or shortcuts. Output a concise report with findings and recommended fixes.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-problem PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a single PDDL domain and one PDDL problem file per scenario. Use STRIPS with :typing, a single type obj for all objects, and keep action names exactly: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Include only the predicates needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags, and each PDDL problem between <problem name='...'> and </problem> tags. Ensure the problems compile and are consistent with the curated operators, grounded models, and audit guidance.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the operators from {domain_spec}, the grounded scenarios from {grounded_models}, and the consistency guidance from {audit_report}. Emit one domain and two problems (problem_scenario_1 and problem_scenario_2), each with the exact object list, init facts, and goals. Do not change action names or predicate signatures. Target FastDownward conventions and ensure solvability when the audit report indicates it is possible.
